website_summaries.verdict: Fun and colorful, this toy helps kids develop fine motor skills. An inexpensive toy that toddlers will love.
pros: Fun colors and happy faces are a great surprise for games
Teeter totter design offers endless play

customer_reviews.title: LEAD BASED PAINT
customer_reviews.text: The pain on this is lead based - made in china! My son loves to chew on the hammer, had elevated lead levels at his check up. Tested the paint on this hammer and sure enough. I am so appalled I thought Melissa and Doug was a good brand.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne Haverland

customer_reviews.title: A nice toy for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: My 20 mo old sits and plays with this thing often. He doesn't like the hammer too much, so instead he pushes the pieces down one by one with his hands. He laughs when the opposite side pieces pop up. I'm glad the pieces don't come out of the little wood table, so no pieces to pick up at the end of the day. It looks sturdy enough to last even though the pieces are plastic. My son has dropped the table so many times and it still looks new. This is one of the toys I use to teach my son colors and counting. Since my son is happy with this toy, I am happy too.
customer_reviews.author: Cat LadyTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars for simple, and sturdy. be good for preschools or waiting rooms
customer_reviews.text: Within minutes the 1 1/2 yr old utilized the hammer as a weapon against the 4yr old. they still enjoy without the hammer.. product is built sturdy I'm 160lbs and it held my weight just fine. not a bad product. Recommend for little kids. Interest is lost fairly quickly but that could just be my kids attention span. Unless your kids act like maniacs this product could be passed around to many children of different families, or sold in a yard sale. .. Recommend removing hammer if used in preschool or waiting room
customer_reviews.author: Chuck and Mary Jones

customer_reviews.title: Pound Foolish
customer_reviews.text: The name "pounding" bench misled me. I would say "tapping" bench since it takes only a touch to drive these pegs home. The hammer is superfluous, a finger, even a child's finger, is enough to push the peg all the way down. No pounding involved. I was expecting to get a true pounder of yore, where a wood shape, say a cylinder, fit through the bench with serious friction, requiring serious, satisfying pounding by your young Bam Bam, if you recall the Flintsones. Good memories of my own pounding so long ago! But what I received was no more than a panel with 8 push buttons. Boring, Boring, Boring and quickly discarded by our own young pounder.
customer_reviews.author: evan1138

customer_reviews.title: The beauty in simplicity
customer_reviews.text: My 1 year old niece got a rainfall of new toys this Christmas, each more impressive, colorful, and noisy than the one before it. I was a little nervous this toy would look boring next to all the vtech and Little Einstein cool toys she got. To my surprise, she wasn't even done opening the rest of her presents when she became mesmerized by the simple mechanism in this toy! She didn't quite know how to handle the little mallet, but she loved pushing the little pegs with her finger! Hours (practically years in toddler time) of fun were had with this toy over the Holidays. 5 Stars!
customer_reviews.author: Cronopia

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Grandson not impressed. He hammered the pegs a couple of times. Tossed the hammer aside and flipped the bench over to see how the pegs worked with up and down motion. Once he figured that out, he turned the bench back over used his fingers to punch the pegs down (the easily push down) to check out his "hypothesis". After that, he was done with this toy ... total time 10 minutes. My recommendation, the old-fashioned pounding bench without any gimmicks, not this one. Be aware that returning the item costs almost as much as the purchase price!
customer_reviews.author: stillwaters

customer_reviews.title: It fell apart :(
customer_reviews.text: I love melissa and doug products but this one didnt live up to their name. It fell apart after we had it for about 2 weeks. I tried to put it back together but had no luck.
customer_reviews.author: Kristian Hargett

customer_reviews.title: welcome addition
customer_reviews.text: This pounding bench has been a welcome addition to our sons sensory toys. As with all M&D toys, this is a great, quality toy. The wood is smooth with no worries of splintering. The painted pegs are vibrantly painted with cute little smily faces. Perfect choice for those little ones who like this type of pounding toy, likes to make noise or loves the cause and effect of the push=pop reaction.
customer_reviews.author: Rachy

customer_reviews.title: This broke after 2 months! The wood is cheap and so was the glue.
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this two months ago and it already broke! The glue wore away from the base and now I have to throw it out. How was this rated the top toy? I have no idea! It seems like they make the glue last exactly 2 months so you can't return it anymore. Do not buy this!
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: The color stained and wouldn’t came off
customer_reviews.text: Okay it’s well made sturdiness and durability wise. But I wish they had keep the legs the same color as the top. The paints stained! My daughter playmat got a red stain from the legs! I had taken care of this playmate well, so that my next one can use it. But I’m so upset this toys ruin it. I’ve tried bleach cleaner to the spot which I don’t normally use for cleaning for my daughter’s toys, But no luck the red stain didn’t came off.
customer_reviews.author: Heaven_above

customer_reviews.title: Seriously why didn't I think of this before!
customer_reviews.text: My 15 month old is very hyper active, literally on the move from the time he wakes up until he goes to bed at night. A friend asked about him and I mentioned how rambly he was (into everything and always on the move) and they mentioned that these toys helped significantly with their child who is similar. I thought it had to be worth a shot and my son has loved it! Just ordered a second one to have at my office (where we keep my son during the day)!
customer_reviews.author: misty poole

customer_reviews.title: Broke quickly
customer_reviews.text: I want to love this toy, and so does my son! Unfortunately, it broke after less than a month of play. The wooden top has come apart from the base, and the colorful wooden pegs pop out from time to time too. It’s still usable I suppose, but it comes apart and frustrates my son because he can’t easily move it around (or play with it on an uneven surface) without the top disconnecting. I just wouldn’t expect something designed to be hammered on to be so fragile. I wouldn’t purchase this again because it’s not made to last.
customer_reviews.author: LA

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy toy! Great alternative to all those musical toys!
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong I love a good electronic toy but sometimes it's just too much. My nephew enjoys pounding on this little bench and it has taken quite the beating. it's made of sturdy wood and last for quite a long time. I purchase this for him after seeing him play with this toy at another child's house. It is provided much entertainment and enjoyment and it's such a great alternative to hearing those repetitive Musical toy songs.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Warbux

customer_reviews.title: Take a chance and order. If you get a bad one, return It and exchange it for another!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this as a child but I was a bit reluctant to order based on some of these reviews. I finally broke down and purchased for my twin grandchildren. They love it! It can get a bit noisy, but well worth it to watch them play with it and have fun! They love it! This is a toy we keep for when they visit. I’m sure they will remember going to grandma and pop pop’s house and playing with it! Hopefully they will remember it with fond memories and be driven to get for their own kids and grandkids in the future!!
customer_reviews.author: Shari

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt do anything productive. Could be better.
customer_reviews.text: The colors are too similar and broad to accurately teach a toddler the difference between teal and baby blue and regular blue. Why make it so hard. Just use 8 basic colors to include black brown and white and this would have been worth the investment for the toddler. Also... He hit me with the mallet then himself all in one fell swoop so I took it away and haven't given it back to him since.
customer_reviews.author: B Williams

customer_reviews.title: Better than the old type with pegs that fall out
customer_reviews.text: This toy is so helpful when using with a small toddler as the pegs do not ever come out. What I mean by this, is that when your toddler hammers one peg in, the opposite one across from it is pushed out so it can then be hammered in. This makes it easier for a small toddler to play with it, without mama having to go put all the pegs back in every few seconds. My 1 year old really enjoys it.
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: 💜
customer_reviews.text: This toy is IDEAL. Heavy duty and not cheap, underneath on bottom the pieces are connected with this plastic to prevent them from coming out from side to side so when one is hit the other side pops up. Vise versa. Pieces do not come out and get all over floor they are connected so all stays together.
customer_reviews.author: Gina M.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good though I prefer order version
customer_reviews.text: This is an updated version of a very old toy. Good quality though the wood is softer than I remember - it dents if hit hard. My 2 yr old grandson is super strong and "whacks" it pretty good 😁. I prefer the original version where you just flipped it back and forth to hammer pegs. With this model when you hammer one it automatically pops another one back up. Probably perfect if you don't have a really strong child. It got boring fast for my grandson
customer_reviews.author: ctw58

customer_reviews.title: Great for all stages of development!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great learning toy for kids! I bought it for my twins and they love it! It is great for eye coordination and cognitive development! It helps develop logic and analytical thinking patterns! This toy great for any children who are developing motor and cognitive skills. This toy can help children with learning disabilities or those who excel, it is a toy for all stages of development. Great investment!!
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: I like that this pounding bench has an automatic reset of ...
customer_reviews.text: I like that this pounding bench has an automatic reset of sorts. The pegs are connected so when the front peg is pounded down the one behind it comes up. It doesn't require flipping like some other brands so I think it's better for younger kids. The pegs don't come off either so (almost) no pieces to lose! I just wish the hammer was attached with some kind of tether. Otherwise, great entertainment for my son.
customer_reviews.author: EMR

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a toddler
customer_reviews.text: My one-year-old grandson loves it. His mom requested a "workbench" where the pegs did not come out. This fits the bill. I'd say it is not really appropriate for older kids because the pegs are loose and very easy to tap (not really a challenge), but his three-year-old sister loves it too. So, what do I know? My grandson could play with it before he got the hang of the hammer, because he could push the pegs easily and watch them pop up elsewhere. Like all Melissa & Doug toys, it is well-made and useful for teaching other concepts during playtime like colors and cause/effect.
customer_reviews.author: Grandmom

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: It fell apart pretty quickly, had bumps and lumps immediately since the wood is so soft, and it wasn’t as effective as I imagined. My daughter liked banging it with the hammer, but it was honestly short lived and pretty useless. A similar toy can be purchased from IKEA for a third of the cost as well. Won’t be purchasing or recommending in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Bolden

customer_reviews.title: An improvementt over the traditional oldschool pounding bench
customer_reviews.text: The weight of this bench is lighter than the old versions and the durability of this toy is great. The pegs have a rocking mechanism underneath the bench so when a peg is hit the one across from it pops up. Kind of like whack'a'mole. Bright colors, high quality and engaging. My grandson loved it from the get go.
customer_reviews.author: CDOI

customer_reviews.title: My son couldn’t care less about it
customer_reviews.text: So this is a sturdy toy just as described. I had high hopes that my son would love it since it appears to be the favorite of so many other small children, however, my 18 month old couldn’t care less about it. Maybe he is too young or maybe he is too old for it, but right now it just Cole ya dust. I still give it 5 starts because the toy itself met my expectations hahaha it’s not the toys fault that my kid doesn’t like it ;)
customer_reviews.author: photoglady

customer_reviews.title: Ok, expected better.
customer_reviews.text: Ok, not the best but it seem to be kind of fun. The pegs that go up and down with the faces are pretty tight in the holes and not very fun to pound since their are two rows and hand gets in the way of getting back row. My son hits it for a second and walk away with the mallet. Lol I would of gotten a different/cheaper one if I knew he wouldn’t like it that much. I knew this was a simple toy but it’s just not that enjoyable. He does love to hit stuff though but not this toy exactly.
customer_reviews.author: rachel

customer_reviews.title: Great activity for babies.
customer_reviews.text: My 9 month old just figured out how to maneuver the pieces up and down first with his hands and then with the hammer at 8 months old. I am a firm believer of monkey see and monkey do with children and playing with this item not only challenged his dexterity but it was also very cute seeing my baby discover the different textures on the toy and looking underneath to see the mechanics of it as well. Highly recommend it as a parent with a preference for Montessori learning.
customer_reviews.author: Laury

customer_reviews.title: Be careful
customer_reviews.text: Loved it so cute only thing is don’t get it for your baby unless they are old enough to know not to hit themselves or fingers with it. My baby is almost 10months and hit his eye with it and almost fingers with the stick. He also flipped it over and it smashed his fingers due to the weight of it. Otherwise very cute toy.
customer_reviews.author: Dick Richards

customer_reviews.title: This toy had a short popularity.
customer_reviews.text: This toy is well made with bright colors and rounded edges. It comes with a hammer the child uses to "pound" the pegs down. When one peg goes down another pops up. They are secured and do not come out. My 20 month grandson quickly lost interest because he could push the pegs down with his fingers and not pull them out. He would be more engaged with the older type.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Miccio

customer_reviews.title: Looks good despite delivery
customer_reviews.text: The bench looks cute. I love Melissa and Doug's products. I am sure my grandson will love it. As for the delivery of the wooden bench and several other items I purchased, I give it ZERO stars. It was delivered via the USPS. I called my complaint in to my local post office immediately. The box was NOT hand delivered to a resident as stated in the delivery confirmation (complete lie) The box was left at the end of my driveway (600ft from the house), on the muddy ground, next to my mailbox, in pouring down rain. They didn't even put it in a plastic bag! I was not a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: momma D

customer_reviews.title: I would buy this again
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for a while now. My daughter, who will be 3 in a month, LOVES it. It keeps her busy for a while on her own. The only downfall to this toy is that within the first weekend of having it the hammer put enough dents in it that it looked used by the time her dad got home from a work trip. He thought maybe I had picked it up from a garage sale. BUT I’m still giving it 5 stars overall because I love the design, it’s structure is sturdy overall, and I would absolutely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Sheena

customer_reviews.title: super durable, great toy for little ones
customer_reviews.text: got this for my son last christmas and he has played with it endlessly. holds up so good. he has pounded on it, thrown it, thrown it down the stairs.. for an entire year.. and it still works and the paint is there and looks great. love melissa & doug and the simplicity of the toys. i wish more company’s would remember how great simple can be. awesome purchase.
customer_reviews.author: sara

customer_reviews.title: Adorable and simple toy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas gift for my 14 mo. old. He loves it more than I expected, however he prefers to mash the colored pieces with his hands than the mallet. But I'm sure he will use it as he gets a little older. It's small enough that it doesn't take up a lot of space and has a good weight to it without being difficult for him to pick up and move around. It's well made, no sharp edges, no flaking so far. It's a fun simple toy that needs no batteries or a lot of loose parts. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sasha R

customer_reviews.title: My little girl LOVES this toy!!!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old girl isn't the type to play with dolls or play kitchens. She loves anything physical and visual so I really wanted to get her something that she would love for Christmas. This was a hit!!! She played with it for a good 45 minutes the first time she saw it. This is a very smartly designed little toy. When you hit one peg, another one pops up. It is well made and she loved the loud clinking sound of the hammer hitting the wood. I purchased this on Black Friday for an amazing price. Melissa and Doug toys are the best!
customer_reviews.author: Wegmej

customer_reviews.title: Fun for younger children even without using the hammer!
customer_reviews.text: Originally purchased this for my twins to use at a later age (when they would not whack other things or each other with the hammer), but I had it out without the hammer and they both played with it for 10 minutes uninterrupted! It was like a mini version of whack a mole! They’d push one peg down with their hand and the other would pop up! I plan on introducing the hammer soon! They’re now 17 months old and still love this toy!
customer_reviews.author: Autumn Majestic

customer_reviews.title: Revamped Classic!
customer_reviews.text: This toy is a new take on the classic pounding bench! The "nails" have a curved piece of wood attached to the bench underneath them that keep them from coming out and getting lost! How smart is that?!?! I bought this as a gift for a friend's son and he and my daughter played with it for a lot of the day. He just loves it and so does Mom who isn't constantly looking for missing pieces. The construction is sound and it's an entertaining toy for young children. The motor skills development that this helps to develop are invaluable to development, every child should have this toy!!
customer_reviews.author: Maggie0981

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy toy and fun for toddler
customer_reviews.text: Son loves it. Even the older kids seem to entertain themselves for a little bit with this! Has help up pretty well for having a bunch of kids hitting it. My son has even dropped it from our dinner table and even stands on it and nothing has happened. This was a Christmas present so it’s been used for about two months daily.
customer_reviews.author: Marisol R.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality toy
customer_reviews.text: My 22 month old loves this. It was recommended by his play therapist, who uses it in her work. It is colorful and durable, good quality. It can be used to teach about colors and the concepts of up and down, as well as fine motor skills. Just be prepared for the banging noise.
customer_reviews.author: Raven Elise

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for one year-old
customer_reviews.text: I gave this toy to my grandson who is almost 14 months. It was perfect for him. He doesn’t use the hammer much, just pushes the little pegs down with his fingers. I can see that when he gets older, he will use the hammer to bang the pegs. It’s a perfect toy for a little boy who just likes to mess around with things, and it’s not overly expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Pixiegirl

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed but good toy.
customer_reviews.text: Not what I was expecting. A bit disappointed it's only a way way pound not like the older version where you pound them all in and flip the whole board to pound them in again. Toddler got irritated when one would pop up the same time she got one down. Pegs are also very loose, most of them fall down on their own. She enjoyed it for a minute but then got irritated and hasn't touched it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Krystin E

customer_reviews.title: Ok toy
customer_reviews.text: Writing this review after this has been in our home over a year. Bought this because I liked the mechanism under the pegs. Liked how I wouldn't have to assist with re-setting after a few hits. Definitely helped with hand-eye coordination, etc. However the pegs are painted and we did get chips quickly. Also, my kid definitely would use the wooden hammer to hit more than the pegs. Just keep that in mind...
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and played with often!
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift to my granddaughter. She and others play with it often. It is well constructed easy for little people to use. Watch the little fingers if two play together though. But as an adult and a child playing together, great toy. Quite fun
customer_reviews.author: rhonda turnage

customer_reviews.title: Great Classic Hammering Toy.
customer_reviews.text: A great classic wooden toy. Well made. Hammer down on one side and it lifts the other post up. Once you have them all down on one side just turn it around and start hammering away again. All the parts stay together except the wooden hammer which is designed for small hands.No more searching for pieces scatter over the floor and trying to hold the "nail" straight in the hole while hammering. Great hand to eye coordination. Keeps them amused for hours. Definitely, recommend. My 3-year old loves it.
customer_reviews.author: kykim41042

customer_reviews.title: I should have bought a vintage version.
customer_reviews.text: Melissa & Doug have sold out, this thing is junk. It's a toy that should require a hammer to pound down pegs. If it doesn't work and fit together like it should, it's pointless. If anyone is thinking about building wooden toys, you've got very little competition here. All you have to do is make something that fits together and functions.
customer_reviews.author: Fredrick C.

customer_reviews.title: I should’ve chose plastic, cuz my daughter likes to throw stuff
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves to play this game but she also loves throwing things around! I guess every two-year-old does ha ha Ha so the first time she threw it the right side came off,But superglue will fix it just right I think maybe a plastic one would of been better for my daughter
customer_reviews.author: Sara T.

customer_reviews.title: durable, 2 year old LOVES it
customer_reviews.text: At first was skeptical as kid didnt quite know what to do with it (1.2 years old). now being almost 2 years old, she loves it. loves to just use her hands. she comes back to it again and again. great to teach colors also. she'll occasionally use hammer but mostly likes to do it by hand. Never gets old! the build on this is great to take massive hammer impacts heh!
customer_reviews.author: Alex L.

customer_reviews.title: Classic toy
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 2 yr old grandson. His father had an older version of a similar toy and both, at that age, loved to hammer stuff. It has been frequently used. This version is convenient because the pegs can be hammered but they cannot fall out of the frame. This will be a sturdy toy that most kids would like.
customer_reviews.author: SDM

customer_reviews.title: A toy that doesn't need Batteries
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 2 1/2 yr old twin grandsons. They had fun but I took away the wood hammer and used a plastic hammer because I didn't want them hitting each other. Was useful for ppunding colors and learning up and down concept and fast and slow. An oldie but goody toy.
customer_reviews.author: vidviews

customer_reviews.title: Old toy renewed
customer_reviews.text: Rocker panels on bottom push the pegs up after pounded. Wooden mallet worked well, until it was used as a tool to clobber his brother. Hammer is now in time out. Great for color recognition, eye hand coordination, and practicing self control.😉
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia K.

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my sons 1st birthday. It took him a few times to get it right but he has been steadily improving his hand eye coordination every time he uses this toy. The toy is great quality and holds together even after my son has thrown it out of his crib on multiple occasions. My only wish is that the hammer was attached to the toy or had a slot to keep it in. It's hard to keep toys together for a 1 year old who wants to hammer everything in the house including people. All in all great toy, good for development, skill building, amazing quality.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Safer style, but not as much fun for our grandchild as the old style
customer_reviews.text: This is the newer style that is safer than to old peg and mallet toy. You can just press these pegs down without using the mallet and our 20 month old does just that most of the time. We still have the old mind where the child can we did get blood blisters when beating on the pegs.
customer_reviews.author: CobraJ

customer_reviews.title: Love the design in that I am not trying to ...
customer_reviews.text: Love the design in that I am not trying to collect pieces when it's time to clean up the toys. Every piece (with the exception of the hammer of course) is connected - so no loose pegs! Great for teaching cause and effect to little ones. As they get older it is also great for teaching that every action has an opposite and equal reaction.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Gampp

customer_reviews.title: Best pounding bench on the market!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best twist on a pounding bench that I have ever seen. I wasnt wure when I ordered it , how it worked. But once my 8 month old grandson started playing with it, he figured it out. Its great because there are no loose pieces other then the hammer. Hit one down, another pops up. No need to try to put pegs back in holes. no choking hazard, other then the hammer handle. Common sense, dont let the kids run with the hammer. This is my #1 best gift I got grandkids for Christmas. Very impressed with it!!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Paint comes off the toy's handle
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this toy 5 stars except there is one flaw that has knocked it down to a 3 star review. I am a nanny for a 12 month old and she really likes this toy. She's at the age where she's putting everything in her mouth, including the blue handle on the little hammer. After a few seconds, she had blue all over her mouth from the paint on the toy. I know it's child safe paint but still... very disappointed with that aspect. Otherwise, the toy is easy and fun to use.
customer_reviews.author: abc123

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: This is great, I bought this for for my grand son and I did not realize that it was designed for the blocks to stay attached - not fall completely through. That’s a very neat idea because you don’t lose any of the blocks he hammers.
customer_reviews.author: hppygirl32

customer_reviews.title: The hammer is very solid and hard
customer_reviews.text: It looked very cute online, but when we got it I realized it wasn't a very good idea for my 1 year old at the time. My son is 2 now, but even then we hid the hammer. The hammer is solid wood and very hard, and if your boy is anything like my boy...he likes to bang on all kinds of things. He ended up putting some small dents in the wall, and almost accidentally hit my 5 yr old w/it. I would recommend finding one that is made out of plastic or of lighter material for your child's safety.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: 2 year old loves it. I was nervous at first giving him a hammer to wack stuff with but he has fun and that’s all that matters. Found out what other toys were durable and what ones weren’t based off this toys hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P

customer_reviews.title: I think my 16-month old grandson is going to love this! I got it as a last minute ...
customer_reviews.text: I think my 16-month old grandson is going to love this! I got it as a last minute CHRISTMAS present and it arrived very quickly. I remembered how much my kids loved this little bench and assumed their kids will love it as much as they did. I especially like the feature that you can't pound the pegs all the way out. That way they can't put them in their mouth and chew on them or lose them. We also bought him a Melissa and Doug piano which I have already reviewed. With a piano and a pounding bench I have a feeling there will be lots of noise going on in their house...exactly what grandparents are for!!
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne Gourley

customer_reviews.title: Ok, could be better
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy n durable. I think that if it’s colorful, it would be an attention getter than not. Grandson played more with the hammer than the stick pieces. He touched them n that was it. He used the hammer as a hammer for his other toys😁😂.
customer_reviews.author: Tiana

customer_reviews.title: It's a hit
customer_reviews.text: I opened box while he played across room quietly. Sat simply holding the new toy, once spotted his eyes light up and he raced to my side. Toy is a hit. He studies it to see how it works, uses fingers to press pegs down and to pull them up while watching the underside.
customer_reviews.author: Babebbj

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice toy however the down side is it is wood and wood is heavy and if you have an "active" toddler they may fall on it or over it and this has with sharp and very hard edges so one needs to be paying attention at all times when this is in use with younger toddlers, otherwise it is really nicely made and will last through many children.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma H

customer_reviews.title: Infuriates my child
customer_reviews.text: Infuriates my child. The pegs are joined so that when one peg goes down another pops up, resulting in an endless game of whack-a-mole that can't be won. It's fun for about a minute, then frustrating, and then must be promptly removed before it sends a tiny tot into a bull blown tantrum.
customer_reviews.author: Erik D Tande

customer_reviews.title: It came used with missing hammer! I didn’t order used!
customer_reviews.text: This would have been perfect IF it actually came with the hammer! Ours came missing the hammer AND it was all scratched like it had been used. I didn’t order a new one. We ended up making our own makeshift hammer because my daughter saw it and loved. Just wasn’t worth the haste of returning with everything going on!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and entertaining.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son’s first Christmas. He’s 10 months old and loves anything that makes noise. The overall quality of the toy is sturdy and tough - trust me, I hit it with the hammer a few times before giving it to him. What I really like about it is that the ‘nails’ are not removable. When you puns one down another pops up keeping all pieces together.
customer_reviews.author: Richelle

customer_reviews.title: Great for hand-eye coordination
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the most-used toy in our house for our 10-month old! A perfect toy for developing hand- eye coordination. Just be careful to take hammer from your little one afterwards. Our dude likes to carry it with him, even to “see the doggie” (yikes lol)!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel S.

customer_reviews.title: I wish I'd bought the FP
customer_reviews.text: When you hammer one peg the opposite one pops up, I would prefer the old FP one where what you hammer down stays hammered down then you flip the bench over and hammer those. It seems frustrating that they don't stay down.
customer_reviews.author: L. ALLEN

customer_reviews.title: The pegs are loose
customer_reviews.text: Normally I love Melissa and Doug toys and the concept of this one is fine, but the pegs are really loose. My daughter got it for her first birthday and she can easily push the pegs down with her hand. I wish they were stiffer and the hammer was useful or necessary. Update: We've had this bench for four months now. The pegs are now so loose that some of them fall on their own and don't stay up unless they are being pushed up by the plastic piece underneath. Definitely skip this one. There are better peg benches.
customer_reviews.author: R. Young

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this toy. The only thing is that after hammering away for a few days the paint on the pegs are already starting to chip. Other than that my son loves this toy. The only thing is that after hammering away for a few days the paint on the pegs are already starting to chip. Other than that (and the loud banging noise lol) it’s a great toy for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Not as durable as expected
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my toddler who loves to bang on things..I wanted her to have a better "outlet" if you may. It is a great item, it just isn't as durable as I thought t would be--hence 4 stars. One of the hammer corner split on the first day..it's a small split that does not affect its function but could possibly splinter off in the future. The only thing my kid hit was the toy too..we still love it, just wish it were more durable
customer_reviews.author: Andrea A.

customer_reviews.title: Glue didn't last so toy had to be repaired prior to giving as a gift!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for my grandson and just unpacked the box tonight. I took the cellophane off the toy as I planned to wrap in box with all the hazardous packing removed. I was surprised to find the glue was brittle and the top is no longer attached to the bottom. Too late for me to get replaced so I'll be trying some type of glue tomorrow. I expected better from Melissa and Doug.
customer_reviews.author: E. Synco

customer_reviews.title: Great for that hands on child.  Good learning tool.
customer_reviews.text: Great Bench. I would suggest that you drill a hole through the mallet an connect it to the table with whatever medium you have laying in your garage. Don't make it to long so its a hazard to your child. Otherwise the mallet may be used to bang onto other things in your home. Hard to teach to smaller children that it is meant for just that bench. Very well constructed and did keep the child busy for some time . Good to work with them to teach colors as well. Constructed well.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer RN

customer_reviews.title: ... 5) his first Christmas and it is still in great condition and being played with by my youngest nephew ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my oldest nephew (who will be 5) his first Christmas and it is still in great condition and being played with by my youngest nephew (who just turned 2). It is a heavy material and has held up to a lot of use and still looks great. It still functions perfectly and all of the different colors have held up with no chipping or peeling. I would definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy toy for rough, little boys.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2 year old grandson. He loves it. It helps with hand/eye coordination and gave him lots of pleasure.....until he cracked me in the knee with the hammer. Since then the hammer has been “lost” but he still insists on banging on this with anything else he can get his hands on or he will just stand on it while he watches tv. A great toy for kids but be mindful of that hammer.
customer_reviews.author: JessicasInterest

customer_reviews.title: just ok
customer_reviews.text: Not as sturdy feeling as the kind purchased for my children who are now adults; should have held on to theirs.. This is ok but boring as pushing through is very easy and the pegs do not come out. Grandson plays with this intermittently. He is very good with eye/hand coordination and problem solving so even at 18 months this does not challenge him.
customer_reviews.author: mcmahonashley

customer_reviews.title: Great for my 12 month old
customer_reviews.text: Love this item. Bought it for my 1 year old (12m) and he absolutely loves it. He figured out how to use the hammer. Doesn’t always use it, but he’s still young but definitely helps with hand eye coordination and safe
customer_reviews.author: raquel

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT, and more important
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE IT, and more important, my baby loves it!!! As soon as he saw it, he started banging, hitting.. he was so excited and it's such a pleasure to see how much fun a little baby can have with it. He's 11 months and plays with it every single day now... even his older sister love playing with this smart and simple toy! Great price and so worth the money! Absolutely recommended for babies with high curiosity and that like to explore.
customer_reviews.author: mamivee

customer_reviews.title: Great workable toy!
customer_reviews.text: No dislikes! Great product for my 2 yr old grandson. Durable, takes a beating. Cause and effect quality of this simple well made toy evokes fun and curiosity. Absolutely well done at a more than fair price!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Our granddaughter Loves it
customer_reviews.text: This little bench is great. It's really sturdy, and the pegs don't get lost (they're attached to the bench itself). Our granddaughter loves to pound it with the hammer, and use her hand. It's a great toy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I came in fast great looking simple toy
customer_reviews.text: I came in fast great looking simple toy. As soon as I took it out my 2 year old is in love with it 😍... he is hammering it so hard I am worried fr poor toy 😅... he loves it and I love that. Decent price.. sturdy construction... although i want to warn parents/ guardians/ baby sitters it is pain fully loud 🤨..
customer_reviews.author: xyz123

customer_reviews.title: It's study and it's better than another version I had gotten for my five ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 15 month old grand daughter and she loves it. She mostly used her hands to push them down though. The hammer is just now coming into play with her starting to grip and wield the hammer a bit at 17 months. It's study and it's better than another version I had gotten for my five year old grandson when he was that age. The pegs could be pushed all the way through on that version and eventually he did just that. They then got lost of course. This is sturdy and good product, with sharp corners rounded off nicely and I believe it's going to last quite awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Frustation
customer_reviews.text: The toy was just as described. However, the child was very frustrated that the pegs would not come out. He lost interest in this pretty quickly. I would recommend one that has removable pegs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: But she does seem to enjoy playing with this
customer_reviews.text: I am with other people on this, where they say they wish the hammer was somehow attached to it. Because I am consistently searching for what my toddler did with the hammer so she can play with this. But she does seem to enjoy playing with this, and she gets frustrated at times because she wants all the little men down at once, and as you can tell that isn't going to ever happen. But boy does she keep trying! lol :)
customer_reviews.author: Tori

customer_reviews.title: but he does enjoy pushing down on each colored peg
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my toddler and he loves this toy! Although I did have to hide the hammer that came with it because he started hammering the walls and everything else in the house....but he does enjoy pushing down on each colored peg. I first came across this toy from a friend who posted a video of their kids playing with it. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sophia

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I love melissa and doug products!! My two year old has literally beat this thing to death and back. It has held up so well to his beatings. Lol. They make their products very sturdy and last a long time. Im able to pass these toys down my nephews.
customer_reviews.author: Casey layton

customer_reviews.title: Bam bam bam
customer_reviews.text: Fun little toy for my little one. Pretty well made and takes a pounding without any issues. This thing can get loud, so it's officially a day time use toy. It's used multiple times a week and still holding up strong.
customer_reviews.author: Angela & Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart during first use
customer_reviews.text: This fell apart during it's first use which is ridiculous- one of the ends and the bottom part all came apart. Gluing it back together but as this was a gift it was crumby to see this happen
customer_reviews.author: S S Minn

customer_reviews.title: Cute
customer_reviews.text: Looks cute and feels sturdy. Nothing bad has happened to ours yet. It can get a little dangerous with the hammer but kids can turn any toy into a weapon. I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Love it!

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: Excellent toy for a toddler! He actually plays with it and looks to see how it works. Great quality and I love the fact the pegs are anchored in the toy. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute but loud and hammer is kinda dangerous for wild boys
customer_reviews.text: It’s just really loud!! Cute tho but I did give it toy one year old and he instantly went and hit the dog and his sister with it so... I see why it says 2 and up for sure
customer_reviews.author: suzy

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Toy for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: My toddlers go crazy over this toy. We have had it for 6 months and they still play with it everyday. It's very cute and original. I would give this as a gift because it stands out from the crowd of random plastic gifts. The construction is solid.
customer_reviews.author: Orchid

customer_reviews.title: Good Toy!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this toy! She’s 18 months old and we saw this at an indoor play world and she just had to play with it. It does come with a hammer and another review mentioned giving a toddler a weapon is dangerous so she doesn’t know it came with a hammer. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Cheeze90

customer_reviews.title: Pegs are too easy to pound
customer_reviews.text: A disappointment for this brand. My great grandson wants to pound on it but the pegs fall down with almost no effort. I guess the old fashioned kind of pounding toy would be better.
customer_reviews.author: Gramma

customer_reviews.title: Well made, but a bit easy to move pegs
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for 2 year old to increase hand-eye coordination and teach cause-and-effect. It is well-made and sturdy. I wish it were a bit harder to push down the pegs. My son doesn’t feel motivated to use the hammer for more than a minute, because it’s easier to push the pegs down with his hands.
customer_reviews.author: A Friendly Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Wood is soft
customer_reviews.text: Your kid will love to pound the pegs down in this Pounding Bench. Keep in mind though that the wood is really soft. You can see a lot of indents where the mallet has hit the wood top. Otherwise, it works great and my son loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Mikurie

customer_reviews.title: Love that the pegs don't come out
customer_reviews.text: Love that the pegs don't come out. unfoetubately the baby figured out she doesn't need the hammer to move the pegs. She's able to push them down with her hand. Still keeps her busy though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My one year old enjoys it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this toy for my one year old daughter. She was so proud of herself for taking the hammer and pounding the pieces! I think she enjoys it and thinks it’s pretty neat. It’s different then the regular ole toys.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Best of the best
customer_reviews.text: Everything by Melissa and Doug is second to none. Best products on the market. Reminds me of our grand parents toys that lasted two lifetimes. I am just a parent, no affiliation to Melissa and Doug.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Babies love it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for twin grandsons (9 months) and they love it. They can't pull the lever yet, but this is a toy that they can use for at least the next year+. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta Nadel

customer_reviews.title: So much fun.
customer_reviews.text: The baby loves this and the pegs are self contained (you don't have to contently pick the pegs up). The pegs have cute faces and the baby notices them !
customer_reviews.author: Donna M. Bigouette

customer_reviews.title: Pegs a little loose
customer_reviews.text: We have the old version of this at my mom's house and my daughter loves it, so I thought we'd upgrade for our house. She uses the mallet at grandma's, but the little pegs are looser on this one than the old one, so she just uses her hands to push them down and then she's bored. I think the stiffness of the pegs in the old one provide more of a challenge so she uses the hammer. Wish we had bought the old one for our house.
customer_reviews.author: Momof3

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Returned due to missing hammer and overall poor quality of product.
customer_reviews.author: tracian malcolm

product_meta.title: Melissa & Doug Deluxe Pounding Bench
product_meta.description:
A beloved classic toy gets an exciting new twist with this deluxe pounding bench. As the colorful, non-removable pegs on the bench go up and down, they play peekaboo, taking turns showing their friendly smiles while the child has fun practicing fine motor skills. And you’ll enjoy that because the pegs are attached, they can’t get lost. A sturdy wooden mallet is included. Children delight in striking a peg with the mallet and watching one on the opposite side pop up. Once kids have seen this cause-and-effect in action, they will enjoy predicting which peg will pop up next. As they develop hand-eye coordination and fine motor skills, they will also be learning numbers and colors by counting the pegs and naming each color as it pops up. The Melissa & Doug Deluxe Pounding Bench Wooden Toy makes a great gift for kids 2 to 4 years. This product measures 5.25" H x 10" L x 5" W and includes a sturdy wooden mallet. Add the Melissa & Doug Wooden Latches Board to round out the developmental play and learning experience. For more than 30 years, Melissa & Doug has created beautifully designed imagination- and creativity-sparking products that NBC News called “the gold standard in early childhood play.” Today, Melissa & Doug is proudly partnering with the American Academy of Pediatrics to foster early brain development and help children build important life skills through play.

BRAND STORY
By Melissa & Doug

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
From classic wooden toys to crafts, pretend play, and games, Melissa & Doug products provide a launch pad to ignite imagination and a sense of wonder in all children so they can discover themselves, their passions, and their purpose. 

Since the company’s founding more than 25 years ago, Melissa & Doug has consistently delivered innovative products that inspire open-ended thinking, encourage kids to see new possibilities, and offer Countless Ways to Play. It’s part of a bigger vision to Take Back Childhood. Because by giving children a true childhood with the space and freedom to explore their world, we give them a path to realizing their full potential!

See more
feature_bullets: CLASSIC POUNDING TOY: The Deluxe Pounding Bench Wooden Toy with Mallet is a classic pounding toy with a design twist. As the colorful, non-removable pegs on the bench go up and down, they play peekaboo, taking turns showing their friendly smiles.

HELPS DEVELOP FINE MOTOR SKILLS: Our pounding bench is an exceptional learning toy that helps children practice fine motor skills. The action of the pegs helps children name the colors and provides an effective, hands-on, screen-free play option.

DURABLE WOODEN CONSTRUCTION: This wooden toy set with mallet is made from high-quality materials. The built-in pegs are non-removable, and each component is made from solid wood – for superior strength and longevity.

GREAT GIFT FOR 2 TO 4 YEARS: The Melissa & Doug Deluxe Pounding Bench Wooden Toy makes a great gift for kids ages 2 to 4 years. Add the Melissa & Doug Wooden Latches Board to round out the developmental play and learning experience.

“THE GOLD STANDARD IN CHILDHOOD PLAY”: For more than 30 years, Melissa & Doug has created beautifully designed imagination- and creativity-sparking products that NBC News calls “the gold standard in early childhood play.”

100% HAPPINESS GUARANTEE: We design every toy to the highest-quality standards, and to nurture minds and hearts. If your child is not inspired, give us a call and we'll make it right. Our phone number is on every product!
